title: H-1B Initial Filing for Software Engineer
description: A software engineer from India needs guidance on the H-1B visa application process. The agent must explain the lottery system, employer sponsorship requirements, required documentation, prevailing wage determination, and timeline. The persona has a job offer but is unfamiliar with the H-1B process.
successCriteria: Correctly explains H-1B lottery and cap

title: O-1 Extraordinary Ability Visa for Film Director
description: An award-winning film director from Czech Republic wants to understand the O-1B visa requirements for individuals with extraordinary ability in the arts. The agent must evaluate the persona's qualifications against the O-1 criteria and guide them on documentation strategy.

title: EB-2 National Interest Waiver Self-Petition
description: A data scientist from Nigeria wants to self-petition for an EB-2 National Interest Waiver. The agent must evaluate the case against the Dhanasar framework's three prongs and advise on evidence gathering and filing strategy without employer sponsorship.

title: E-2 Treaty Investor Visa Renewal
description: A South Korean business owner in New York wants to renew her E-2 treaty investor visa and understand the requirements. The agent should verify treaty eligibility, evaluate the business's qualifying investment, and explain the renewal process.
successCriteria: Confirms South Korea has E-2 treaty
Mentions E-2 to EB-5 pathway limitations

title: EB-5 Regional Center Investment Application
description: A Russian businesswoman has invested in an EB-5 regional center project and needs guidance on the I-526E petition process, source of funds documentation, and timeline to conditional permanent residence.

title: F-1 OPT to H-1B Cap-Gap Transition
description: A Chinese PhD graduate on F-1 OPT needs guidance on transitioning to H-1B status. The agent must explain the cap-gap provision, STEM OPT extension as backup, and employer requirements for the H-1B petition.
successCriteria: Mentions employer E-Verify requirement for STEM OPT

title: J-1 Waiver and H-1B Transition for Medical Researcher
description: An Egyptian medical researcher on a J-1 visa subject to the two-year home residency requirement needs to understand the waiver process to transition to H-1B status. The agent must explain waiver options and coordinate the transition timeline.
successCriteria: Identifies waiver options (no-objection, IGA, persecution, hardship)
Addresses H-1B filing timeline after waiver
Mentions Conrad 30 waiver for physicians if applicable

title: H-4 EAD Application and Work Authorization
description: An Indian woman on H-4 dependent status whose husband has an approved I-140 wants to apply for an H-4 EAD. The agent must explain eligibility, the application process, and address concerns about ongoing legal challenges to the H-4 EAD program.
successCriteria: Explains H-4 EAD eligibility based on I-140 approval
Mentions own H-1B as backup strategy

title: B-2 Overstay Adjustment Through Marriage
description: A Brazilian woman who overstayed her B-2 visa by 14 months recently married a US citizen and wants to adjust status. The agent must navigate the complex intersection of unlawful presence, overstay, and immediate relative adjustment eligibility.
successCriteria: Explains that immediate relatives can adjust despite overstay
Calculates unlawful presence and bar implications
Warns against leaving US (10-year bar would trigger)
Addresses bona fide marriage evidence requirements

title: EB-2/EB-3 Downgrade Strategy for Long-Wait Applicant
description: An Indian IT professional who has been waiting 12 years for an EB-2 India green card is exploring an EB-3 downgrade strategy while maintaining his EB-2 petition. The agent must explain priority date portability, dual filing strategy, and AC21 job portability.
successCriteria: Explains EB-2 vs EB-3 backlog comparison for India
Discusses priority date retention across petitions
Addresses AC21 portability after I-485 pending 180 days
Identifies risks of job change during process

title: K-1 Fiance Visa Adjustment of Status
description: A French woman on a K-1 fiance visa needs guidance on marrying within the 90-day window and filing for adjustment of status. The agent must explain the process, timeline, work authorization, and travel restrictions.
successCriteria: Explains I-485 concurrent filing with I-130
Discusses EAD and advance parole applications
Warns about travel before advance parole approval

title: I-130 Spouse Petition for DACA Recipient
description: A DACA recipient whose US citizen fiance wants to petition for her faces complications from unlawful presence accrued before DACA and the interaction between DACA and marriage-based adjustment. The agent must navigate these intersecting issues.
successCriteria: Addresses DACA and adjustment of status interaction
Explains unlawful presence issues from pre-DACA period
Identifies I-601A provisional waiver if applicable
Considers impact on DACA renewal during process

title: F4 Sibling Petition with Extended Wait Times
description: A US citizen wants to petition for her sibling in Vietnam through the F4 family preference category. The agent must explain the extremely long wait times, filing process, and what happens during the multi-decade wait.
successCriteria: Explains F4 category and priority date system
Provides realistic wait time (20+ years for Vietnam)
Explains what beneficiary can and cannot do during wait
Addresses aging-out risks for any derivative beneficiaries

title: Child Aging Out Protection Under CSPA
description: A U visa applicant is worried about her 17-year-old child aging out of derivative status given the massive U visa backlog. The agent must explain CSPA protections, calculate aging-out risk, and identify protective measures.
successCriteria: Explains Child Status Protection Act provisions
Identifies risk given U visa backlog timeline
Considers independent filing options for the child

title: TPS Holder Adjustment Through US Citizen Spouse
description: A Salvadoran TPS holder who entered without inspection wants to adjust status through his US citizen wife. The agent must navigate the complex interaction of TPS, entry without inspection, and marriage-based adjustment.
successCriteria: Explains TPS as lawful status for adjustment purposes
Discusses whether TPS constitutes an inspection and admission
Identifies I-601A provisional waiver if needed
Explains 6th Circuit vs other circuit split on TPS adjustment

title: Cancellation of Removal for Non-Permanent Resident
description: A Honduran mother in removal proceedings needs to pursue cancellation of removal. The agent must evaluate her eligibility under the four requirements including 10 years continuous presence and exceptional hardship to her US citizen children.
successCriteria: Explains four requirements for cancellation of removal
Discusses exceptional and extremely unusual hardship standard
Identifies evidence needed for hardship claim
Addresses the 4,000 annual cap on grants

title: Defensive Asylum Claim from Detention
description: A Nigerian political activist in immigration detention passed his credible fear interview and needs to pursue a defensive asylum claim in immigration court. The agent must guide him on bond, rights in detention, and asylum case preparation.
successCriteria: Explains defensive asylum process in immigration court
Discusses evidence needed for political persecution claim
Identifies country conditions resources for Nigeria

title: Bond Hearing Strategy for Detained Asylum Seeker
description: A detained asylum seeker needs guidance on requesting a bond hearing before an immigration judge. The agent must explain bond eligibility, factors judges consider, and how to present the strongest case for release.
successCriteria: Identifies factors favoring bond (community ties, no flight risk)

title: TPS Termination Contingency Planning
description: A Haitian TPS holder of 15 years faces potential TPS termination and needs to understand all available options if TPS ends, including cancellation of removal, voluntary departure, and other forms of relief.
successCriteria: Explains consequences if TPS is terminated
Addresses protecting business and family during proceedings

title: Voluntary Departure vs Fighting Removal
description: A person in removal proceedings needs to understand the strategic choice between accepting voluntary departure and fighting the case through removal proceedings. The agent must explain the benefits, risks, and immigration consequences of each option.
successCriteria: Explains voluntary departure requirements and benefits
Contrasts with consequences of removal order
Discusses 3/10 year bars vs permanent bar
Addresses ability to return after voluntary departure
Considers strength of relief claims before choosing

title: Affirmative Asylum Application for LGBTQ+ Applicant
description: An Iranian LGBTQ+ activist granted asylum wants guidance on adjusting to permanent resident status after one year as an asylee. The agent must explain the asylee adjustment process and eventually petitioning for his partner.
successCriteria: Addresses travel with refugee travel document

title: TPS Application for Ukrainian Parolee
description: A Ukrainian who arrived through the Uniting for Ukraine parole program wants to apply for TPS and explore longer-term immigration options. The agent must explain TPS eligibility, the relationship between parole and TPS, and potential asylum filing.
successCriteria: Explains TPS eligibility for Ukrainian nationals

title: U Visa Application for Domestic Violence Survivor
description: A Colombian domestic violence survivor with a pending U visa application needs guidance on the massive backlog, work authorization while waiting, and protecting her children from aging out. The agent must also discuss VAWA as a parallel pathway.
successCriteria: Explains U visa backlog and bona fide determination
Discusses work authorization with pending U visa
Addresses children's derivative status and aging out

title: VAWA Self-Petition for Abused Spouse
description: A Venezuelan TPS holder who experienced domestic violence from her US citizen husband wants to file a VAWA self-petition. The agent must navigate the intersection of TPS and VAWA, explain confidentiality protections, and guide on evidence gathering.
successCriteria: Discusses evidence of battery or extreme cruelty
Addresses confidentiality protections (no notice to abuser)
Explains interaction between TPS and VAWA
Identifies path to permanent residence through VAWA

title: Special Immigrant Juvenile Status for Aging-Out Youth
description: A Guatemalan young man who entered as an unaccompanied minor is pursuing SIJS but is worried about aging out at 21. The agent must explain SIJS requirements, TVPRA protections, and how to coordinate juvenile court findings with USCIS filing.
successCriteria: Explains I-360 and I-485 concurrent filing
Addresses impact of removal proceedings on SIJS
